questions.question: Caesar's Consulship
Which land was excluded from Caesar's first land bill?
How many commissioners did Caesar's first land bill propose?
How would this first bill have been funded?
options: Through proceeds of Pompey's eastern set tlement

questions.question: How did Cato oppose this bill?
options: He opposed it in the Senate
He asked for the bill to be rewritten

questions.question: What did Caesar threaten Cato with in response?
Where did Caesar go next to get his bill passed?
What did Pompey imply he would do to ge t the bill passed?
options: Speak in favour  of it in the Senate

questions.question: What happened to Bibulus on his way to the forum to oppose the bill?
options: He was attacked and dung thrown onto him

questions.question: What did Bibulus proclaim to try to stop the bill?
options: That the year was sacred so no laws could be passed
That Caesar was unqualified to govern
That the Senate should v ote on the matter

questions.question: Why was Caesar able to ignore Bibulus’ proclamation?
options: He was the head of the Senate
He was the Pontifex Maximus (and Pompey was an augur)
He had the support of the people

questions.question: What was the second land bill that Caesar passed known as?
What land was included in this bill that would have angered the optimates?
How did Caesar pass this bill?
options: With the backing of the equites

questions.question: How many allotments was the land divided into?
Who would this land be distributed to?
Who did Caesar use to get Pompey's eastern settlement ratified en bloc?
What did Caesar’s tribune propose be given to Caesar as a command?
Who was this proposal put to?
Who proposed that Transalpine Gaul be added to Caesar’s command when the governor
What did Caesar offer Cicero to try to get him on the side of the Triumvirate?
options: A position as legate in Gaul

questions.question: Who were elected as consuls for 58?
options: L. Calpurnius Piso and A. Gabinius

questions.question: Why was this favorable to Caesar?
options: He had previously supported their election
He had the support of the equites

questions.question: How had Caesar and Pompey further cemented their alliance?
options: By arranging ma rriages for their children
By offering mutual support in the Senate

questions.question: Who did Caesar help become adopted by a plebian family?
Why was this figur e seeking this adoption?
options: He wished to become a Senator
He wanted to become a Tribune

questions.question: What had encouraged Caesar to aid in this adoption?
options: Cicero had attacked Caesar in speeches
Clodius was a supporter of the Senate
He wanted to weaken Pompey’s influence
